intro: Ruschia knysnana, commonly known as Knysna Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptive features to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal areas. Its fleshy leaves are arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps in water retention. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, adding ornamental value to gardens.
